critique: The document establishes an experimental program within the Executive Exchange Program, allowing government agencies to accept voluntary services from private sector participants. It sets limits on the number of participants and duration of the program, and clarifies the legal status of participants, excluding them from certain employee benefits. The order does not explicitly address ideological issues, immigration, or social inclusion. It touches upon executive power by establishing a program, and economic regulation by involving private sector individuals in government service. Federalism and security/liberty are not directly addressed.
